newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Samsung starts coal output at Australia.
newsitem.headline: Samsung starts coal output at Australia.

text.p: Samsung Co Ltd, a unit of Samsung Group, said on Tuesday it has started full production of bituminous coal at Springvale coal mine in Australia.
Samsung said in a statement it expects production of three million tonnes of bituminous coal a year. It has recently completed setting up production facilities at the mine.

Samsung and Cyprus Amax Minerals Co hold equal stakes in the development project, it said. The joint venture plans to invest $190 million until 2013 on the mine which has estimated reserves of 93 million tonnes of bituminous coal.
Samsung will supply two million tonnes of its output annually to Australia's Pacific Power and import the rest for domestic consumption.
